translations: 违法者，不法之徒；（尤指过去的人）亡命徒，逃犯，草莽英雄，被剥夺法律权益者（outlaw 的复数）
禁止，取缔；宣布……不合法，使……成为非法；剥夺（某人的）法律权益（outlaw 的第三人称单数）

sentences.sentence: The ban—one of the strictest in Europe—outlaws smoking in all bars and restaurants.
sentences.translation: 该禁令是欧洲最严厉的禁令之一，禁止在所有酒吧和餐馆吸烟。

sentences.sentence: They said they would rather be outlaws a year in Sherwood Forest than President of the United States forever.
sentences.translation: 他们说，他们宁愿在谢伍德森林当一年的亡命之徒，也不愿永远做美国总统。

sentences.sentence: Some towns found that lynching was the only way to drive away bands of outlaws.
sentences.translation: 有些城镇的人们发现私刑是惟一能够驱走那一帮帮歹徒的方法。
